content: The Pangeo community is starting their Pangeo Showcase series, where speakers give a 15 minute presentation on data/software/open science topics! The first talk will be Wednesday April 7 at 10 AM MST. Seth McGinnis (from CISL) be presenting on "Parallel Analysis Using Pangeo vs the Command-Line" https://pangeo.io/pangeo-showcase.html
The first Pangeo Showcase presentation by Seth McGinnis (from CISL) takes place in an hour - here is the link https://pangeo.io/pangeo-showcase.html

This afternoon at 2 PM MST Lais Carvalho from Quantsight will be presenting on "The New Qhub 0.3: An easy way to deploy/maintain JupyterHub with Dask Gateway" here is the link if you missed Seth's talk from last week the link to the recorded presentation can be found on that page too!
If you'd like to see the complete schedule for the Pangeo Showcase or consider giving your own 15-minute presentation please find information here: https://pangeo.io/pangeo-showcase.html
The talk from Wednesday on Qhub 0.3 has been posted on YouTube if you are interested in watching https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8tmZiT8WpTg

Today's Pangeo Showcase speaker is David Huard who will speaking about "FAIR Climate Services using the Xarray ecosystem and OGC Standards" ! The talk is this afternoon at 2 PM MST see this link to access today's talk and past talks https://pangeo.io/pangeo-showcase.html

Tomorrow's Pangeo Showcase Speaker is Phillip Austin who will be speaking about "OCESE: Open Source Computing for Earth Science Education" at 10 AM MT Reminder - last week's talk has been uploaded and the link can be found on that same page.
Tomorrow's Pangeo Showcase Speaker is Josef Kellndorfe who will be speaking about "The new era of SAR time series: Tackling big EO data analysis and visualization with Pangeo tools" at 2 PM MST
Tomorrow's Pangeo Showcase Speaker is Chelle Gentemann who will be speaking about "Sea Surface Temperature Datasets on the Cloud"! The talk is at 10 AM MST
This afternoon's Pangeo Showcase Speaker is Taher Chegini who will be speaking about "Accessing Hydrology and Climatology database using web services through Python"! The talk starts at 2 PM MST
This morning at 10 AM MST Matt Rocklin from Coiled will be presenting on "Coiled: Dask as a Service" the link to the talk can be found here

Tomorrow the Pangeo Showcase Series will feature the NASA-Openscapes Framework (Julia Lowndes and Erin Robinson)! This is a great opportunity to learn about what is meant by "open science" with concrete examples from their program! The talk is at 10 am tomorrow morning https://pangeo.io/pangeo-showcase.htm

It looks like the next Pangeo Showcase (9/27) is on Intake v2. Given the level of interest in catalogs, seems like it might be of interest to some folks. More info below:

https://discourse.pangeo.io/t/pangeo-showcase-intake-v2-martin-durant-anaconda/3694

Hi folks! This morning at 10am MT, Ryan Abernathey and I will be presenting on "Arraylake: A Cloud-Native Data Lake Platform for Earth System Science": https://discourse.pangeo.io/t/pangeo-showcase-arraylake-a-cloud-native-data-lake-platform-for-earth-system-science/3701

If you missed the Arraylake Pangeo Showcase (like me!) ESIP is having an encore presentation on Monday October 30th: https://discourse.pangeo.io/t/esip-cloud-computing-cluster-oct-30-arraylake-a-cloud-native-data-lake-platform-for-earth-system-science/3753

This week's Pangeo Showcase, “How to transform thousands of CMIP6 datasets to zarr with Pangeo Forge - And why we should never do this again!”, by Columbia University's Julius Busecke, might be of interested to the ESDS community. Abstract and zoom coordinates here.
